\bnum
\num{1} manuSayx; mAnava; manuja; nara: \eng{a man and a brother} namamxMteyeV manuSayx; namamx aNaNxtamamx; saha mAnava. 
\num{2} (anidiRSaTx yA sAmAnayx \parx) obabx manuSayx; obAbxnobabx; vayxkitx; ALu: \eng{any man} yAvanoV obabx; yArAdarobabx (manuSayx): \eng{no man is perfect} yAvanU paripUNaRnalalx. 
\num{3} manuSayxkula; manukula; manuja kula; mAnava -- vagaR, koVTi; mAnavate: \eng{ man is mortal} mAnavanu matayxR. \eng{man is born into trouble} manuSayx huTiTxruvudeV kaSaTxkAkxgi. 
\num{4} vayasakx; pwrxDha; huDuga yA heMgasalalxda pArxpatxvayasisxna gaMDasu; pArxyada gaMDu. 
\num{5} puruSa; gaMDasu. 
\num{6} (tALemxgeTATxga yA BAvoVdevxVgavidAdxga saMboVdhaneyAgi) loV; mahArAya; ayAyx; mahAtamx: \eng{hurry up man (alive)}; beVga mADoV, mahArAya. 
\num{7} obabx; obabx manuSayx, vayxkitx: \eng{what can a man do in such a case?} iMtha saMdaBaRdalilx obabxniMdeVnAdiVtu? 
\num{8} ALu; isamu; vayxkitx; manuSayx: \eng{man for man} ALige ALu. \eng{between man and man} manuSayx manuSayxralilx. \eng{Rs. 5/ -- per man} talA \eng{5} rUpAyigaLaMte. 
\num{9} viroVdhi; shaturx \mo varu. 
\num{10} gaMDu; puruSa; gaMDutanavuLaLxvanu; pwruSavuLaLxvanu; gaMDige yoVgayxvAda guNagaLanunxLaLxvanu; gaMDugali: \eng{she is more of a man than he is} avaLu avanigiMta gaMDu, hecucx pwruSadiMda kUDidavaLu. \eng{play the man} gaMDasinaMte vatiRsu, naDeduko; gaMDugaliyAgiru. 
\num{11} gaMDa; pati: \eng{man and wife} gaMDa heMDati; pati patinx. 
\num{12} (\ca) Ashirxta; avalaMbi; adhiVnanAdavanu. 
\num{13} ALu; seVvaka. 
\num{14} keYyALu; paricAraka; anucara; yajamAnana jateyalelxV iruva seVvaka. 
\num{15} kelasagAra; kelasadALu; kAmiRka: \eng{the employers dismissed the men} mAlikaru kAmiRkaranunx vajA mADidaru, kelasadiMda tegeduhAkidaru. 
\num{16} (\sA\ \bava dalilx) (\kanmu\ adhikArigaLAgirada sAmAnayx) seYnikaru, nAvikaru, \mo varu: \eng{was in command of 200 men} avana keYkeLage \eng{200} seYnikaru (yA nAvikaru) idadxru. 
\num{17} (caduraMga \mo\ ATagaLalilx) yAvudeV kAyi. 
\num{18} obabx vayxkitx, \sA\ gaMDasu: \eng{fought to the last man} koneya vayxkitxyavarege hoVrADidaru. \eng{the (very) man} (nidiRSaTx kelasakekx) (bahaLa) ahaRnAda, takakx, lAyakAkxda, sUkatxnAda, ucitanAda, anurUpanAda -- vayxkitx: \eng{the (very) man for the job} A kelasakekx (bahaLa) lAyakAkxda vayxkitx. 
\num{19} (\AmA) (huDugiya yA taruNiya) nalalx; pirxya; geLeya. 
\num{20} nidiRSaTx aitihAsika kAlada yA lakaSxNada manuSayx, mAnava: \eng{Renaissance man} navoVdaya kAlada mAnava. 
\num{21} avasheVSagaLu doreta sathxLada hesariniMda kareyalAda itihAsapUvaR kAlada mAnava: \eng{Peking man} piVkiMgf mAnava. 
\num{22} (\AmA) hipipxgaLu \mo varalilx saMboVdhaneyAgi \parx: \eng{dig that, man}; adanunx athaRmADikoLaLxyAyx! 
\num{23} benanxTiTxda vayxkitx; anevxVSita vayxkitx. \eng{the police have so far not caught their man} poliVsaru iduvarege tamage beVkAda vayxkitxyanunx hiDidilalx.

\banum
\alnum{a} poliVsinava. 
\alnum{b} (niVgorxVgaLa \ashi) biLiyaru; shevxVta vaNiRVyaru.

\bentry
\word[matter(1)]{matter}
\pron{mAYxTarf}
\gl{\nA}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (yAvudariMda Bwtavasutx AgiruvudoV aMtha) Bwta darxvayx, padAthaR, vasutx: \eng{the matter of which earth is made} BUmiyanunx saqSiTxsalu baLasiruva Bwtadarxvayx. 
\num{2} kiVvu; rasike. 
\num{3} (Atamx, manasusx, \mo vugaLige vayxtirikatxvAda) Bwtavasutx; jaDa darxvayx, padAthaR. 
\num{4} (\takaR) (oMdu parxtijecnxya) viSaya (\rUpa) riVtigaLalilx. 
\num{5} AloVcanA viSaya; nirUpaNa viSaya; ciMtaneya yA aBivayxkitxya vasutx. 
\num{6} (garxMtha, BASaNa, \mo vugaLa) viSaya; vasutx. 
\num{7} (yAvudakekxV kAraNavAda) saMgati; viSaya; vicAra: \eng{a matter for complaint} dUrige AdhAravAda saMgati; PiyARdu koDabeVkAda vicAra. \eng{a matter for regret} shoVcaniVya viSaya. 
\num{8} (mudarxNa) acucxmADida kaqtiya mudirxta BAga; acacxkaSxrada yA mudirxta puTagaLu, hALegaLu. 
\num{9} saraku; padAthaR; vasutx: \eng{postal matter} aMce padAthaR; aMceyalilx ravAnisabahudAda vasutx (\mo vu). 
\num{10} viSaya; vidayxmAna; saMgati; bAbutx: \eng{a hanging matter} neVNu hAkuvaMtha viSaya, tale hoVguva viSaya. 
\num{11} (\shavi) deYhika padAthaR; deVhadalilxruva yA deVhadiMda baruva padAthaR: \eng{faecal matter} heVlu. \eng{grey matter} (meduLinalilxruva) bUdu darxva. 
\num{12} nidiRSaTx -- vasutx, padAthaR: \eng{colouring matter} baNaNx (hAkuva padAthaR). 
\num{13} nidiRSaTx -- bageya vasutx, padAthaR: \eng{printed matter} mudirxta vasutx. \eng{reading matter} Oduva vasutx. 
\num{14} \eng{(the} jote) viSaya; aibu; eDavaTuTx; tapupx; doVSa: \eng{what is the matter?} Enu viSaya? Enu eDavaTATxyitu? 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{a matter of} 
\banum
\alnum{a} sumAru; hecucx kaDime: \eng{for a matter of forty years} sumAru \eng{40} vaSaRgaLa kAla. 
\alnum{b} oMdu viSayavanunx avalaMbisiruva yA adakekx saMbaMdhapaTaTx: \eng{a matter of habit} aBAyxsavananxvalaMbiside. \eng{only a matter of time before they agree} avaru opapxlu savxlapx samaya beVku, aSeTx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} \eng{a matter of course} sAvxBAvikavAgi, sahajavAgi niriVkiSxsabahudAdadudx; yathAkarxmadalilx AgatakakxMthadu. 
\num{3} \eng{a matter of fact} naDeda saMgati; satayx saMgati; nija saMgati; vAsatxvAMsha (Uhe, aBipArxya alalx): \eng{as a matter of fact} (\nAyxshA) vAsatxvAMshadudx; kAnUnu vicAradadxlalx. 
\num{4} \eng{a matter of form} keVvala nitayxgaTaTxle, mAmUlu -- viSaya. 
\num{5} \eng{a matter of law} kAnUnu viSaya; naDediruva saMgatigaLige saMbaMdhisirade kAnUnige, kAnUnina athaRkekx, vAyxKAyxnakekx saMbaMdhisida viSaya. 
\num{6} \eng{a matter of life and death} sAvu badukina parxshenx; AguhoVgina parxshenx; bahaLa muKayx parxshenx. 
\num{7} \eng{as a matter of fact} vAsatxvavAgi; nijavAgi (\kanmu\ tapapxnunx yA tapapxBipArxyavanunx tidudxvAga heVLuva mAtu). 
\hypertarget{matter pagu8}{} 
\numi{8} \eng{for that matter} 
\banum
\alnum{a} aMtidadxlilx; hAgidadxre; aMtidadxre; hAgidadx pakaSxdalilx; A viSayakekx saMbaMdhisidaMte; A viSayadalilx: \eng{for that matter you are no better} hAgidadx pakaSxdalilx niVneVnU utatxmanalalx. 
\alnum{b} matutx nijavAgiyU; nijavAgi kUDa. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{9} \eng{for the matter of that} = \hyperlink{matter pagu8}{?pagu?\((8)\)}. 
\num{10} \eng{in the matter of} (yAvudeV oMdara) viSayadalilx; saMbaMdhadalilx; (adakekx) saMbaMdhisidaMte; (adara) bagegx. 
\num{11} \eng{money matters} haNakAsina viSayagaLu. 
\numi{12} \eng{no matter} 
\banum
\alnum{a} ciMteyilalx; paravAgilalx; aDiDxyilalx: \eng{no matter, this string will do} ciMteyilalx, I dAraveV sAku. 
\alnum{b} EneV AdarU; hAgidadxrU: \eng{will do it no matter what happens} EneV Agali, nAnadanunx mADiyeV mADutetxVne. 
\alnum{c} adu aMthadeVnU muKayxvalalx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{13} \eng{what is the matter?} Enu samAcAra? EnAyitu? vidayxmAnaveVnu? 
\num{14} \eng{what is the matter with} KaMDita adakekx AkeSxVpaNeyilalx. 
\num{15} \eng{what matter?} ciMteyeVke? adariMda AguvudAdarU Enu? adara bagegx ciMte mADabeVkAgilalx, ciMtisabeVkAgilalx, tale keDisikoLaLxbeVkAgilalx. 
\enum
\emng
\eentry

\bentry
\word[mind(1)]{mind}
\pron{meYMDf}
\gl{\nA}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} manasusx; jAcnxna, AloVcane, iceCx, saMkalapx matutx BAvada AsharxyasAthxna; deVhakekx vayxtikarikatxvAda ceVtana. 
\num{2} nenapu; samxqqti; jAcnxpaka; samxraNe: \eng{call it to mind} adanunx nenapige taMduko. 
\num{3} manasisxnalilxruva (nijavAda) aBipArxya: \eng{speak one's mind} (tananx) manasisxna aBipArxya heVLibiDu; manasisxnalilxruvudanunx oDedu yA bicicxheVLu. 
\num{4} (manasisxna) iceCx; saMkalapx. 
\num{5} manoVBAva; manoVvaqtitx; AloVcisuva yA BAvisuva mAgaR, riVti: \eng{opposed to the Indian mind} BAratiVya manoVvaqtitxge virudadhxvAda. 
\num{6} sahaja mAnasika -- parxvaqtitx, sithxti, vaqtitx: \eng{lose one's mind} mAnasika sAvxsathxyX kaLeduko. \eng{in one's right mind} sariyAda manaHsithxtiyalilx. 
\num{7} budidhx; budidhxshakitx; bwdidhxka sAmathayxR: \eng{men of minds} bwdidhxka sAmathayxRgaLuLaLxvaru. 
\num{8} budidhx; vicAra; AloVcane; viveVka: \eng{to lose one's mind} viveVka tapupxvudu; vicArahiVnarAguvudu. 
\num{9} gamana; citetxYkAgarxte: \eng{my mind keeps wandering} nananx manasusx haridADutitxrutatxde. \eng{don't pay him any mind} avanatatx gamana harisabeVDa. 
\num{10} meVdhAvi; dhiVmaMta; mAnasika guNagaLa sAkAraveMdu BAvisiruva vayxkitx: \eng{the world's best minds} jagatitxna atayxMta sherxVSaThx meVdhAvigaLu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \hyperref{kandict_a.pdf}{A}{absence pagu}{absence} \eng{of mind}. 
\num{2} \eng{be in two minds} ibabxgeyAgiru; anishacxyadalilxru; manasusx -- tUgADutitxru, DoVlAyamAnavAgiru. 
\num{3} \eng{be of a} (\engit{or}) \eng{one's mind} oMdeV aBipArxyaviru. 
\num{4} \eng{be of (person's) mind} (obabxnoMdige) omamxtahoMdiru; EkABipArxyaviru; (obabxna aBipArxyavanunx) opupx, `sari'enunx. 
\hypertarget{mindpagu5}{} 
\num{5} \eng{bring to mind} nenapige taru; nenapisu. 
\num{6} \eng{to mind}= \hyperlink{mindpagu5}{?pagu?\((5)\)}. 
\num{7} \eng{cast one's mind back} hiMdAloVcisu; hiMdina kAlavanunx nenesiko. 
\num{8} \eng{change one's mind} manasusx (udedxVsha, guri) badalAyisu. 
\num{9} \eng{come into a person's mind} samxrisikoLaLxlapxDu; vayxkitxya nenapige baru; vayxkitxge nenapAgu. 
\num{10} \eng{come to mind} (BAvane, kalapxne, \mo vu) manasisxge baru, hoLe. 
\num{11} \eng{cross one's mind} manasisxnalilx suLi; manasisxnalilx hAyi; manasisxge baru: \eng{a disturbing thought crossed her mind} kalakuva yoVcaneyoMdu avaLa manasisxnalilx suLiyitu. 
\num{12} \eng{don't mind me} (vayxMgayxvAgi) ninage toVridaMte, ninagiSaTx baMdaMte -- mADu; nananxnenxVnU gamanisabeVDa, gamanisabeVkAgilalx. 
\num{13} \eng{do you mind}! (vayxMgayxvAgi) savxlapx -- keVLu, gamana koDu! (kirikiriyanunx sUcisuva udAgxra). 
\num{14} \eng{frame of mind} citatxvaqtitx; manoVBAva. 
\num{15} \eng{give one's mind to} gamana yA lakaSxyX -- koDu. 
\hyperdef{M}{mind(1) pagu(16)}{} 
\num{16} \eng{give (person) a piece of one's mind} obabxnanunx bayuyx, KaMDisu. 
\hypertarget{mind1pagu17}{} 
\num{17} \eng{go out of mind} maretu hoVgu. 
\hyperdef{M}{mind(1) pagu(18)}{} 
\hypertarget{mind1pagu18}{} 
\num{18} \eng{have a good mind to} (\sA\ pUtiRmADada bedarikeyAgi) (EnanAnxdarU mADalu) manasusx mADu; udedxVshisu; AseyuLaLxvanAgiru; manasisxru; iSaTxpaDu: \eng{I have a good mind to leave you here alone} nanage ninanxnunx oMTiyAgi ililx biTuTx hoVguva manasAsxgide. 
\num{19} \eng{have a great mind to}= \hyperlink{mind1pagu18}{?pagu?\((18)\)}. 
\hyperdef{M}{mind(1) pagu(20)}{} 
\num{20} \eng{have half a mind to}= \hyperlink{mind1pagu18}{?pagu?\((18)\)}. 
\num{21} \eng{have a mind of one's own} savxMta aBipArxya hoMdiru; savxtaMtarx aBipArxya taLeyuva shakitxyiru. 
\hyperdef{M}{mind(1) pagu(22)}{} 
\num{22} \eng{have (it) in mind} udedxVshaviTuTxkoMDiru; udedxVshisu. 
\num{23} \eng{have in one's mind's eye} obabxna kalapxneyalilx yA manasisxnalilx iTuTxko, iTuTxkoMDiru. 
\num{24} \eng{have on one's mind} (yAvudaradeV) yoVcaneyiMda ciMtege -- silukiru, oLagAgiru, ciMtAkArxMtanAgiru. 
\num{25} \eng{in one's right mind} tale sariyAgidudx; budidhx neTaTxgidudx. 
\num{26} \eng{keep in mind} jAcnxpakadalilxTuTxko; nenapinalilxDu. 
\num{27} \eng{know one's own mind} nishicxtABipArxya taLediru; daqDha manasisxniMdiru; nidhARravanunx rUpisikoMDu adakekx aMTikoMDiru: \eng{she may be only a child, but she knows her mind} avaLu keVvala maguvAgirabahudu, Adare avaLadu daqDhavAda manasusx. 
\num{28} \eng{lose one's mind} talekeDu; hucucx hiDi. 
\numi{29} \eng{make up one's mind} 
\banum
\alnum{a} manasusx mADu; nidhaRrisu; niNaRyakekx baru. 
\alnum{b} manasusx gaTiTxmADiko; anivArayxvAdudakekx hoMdiko; samAdhAna mADiko: \eng{the crop is ruined and we must make up our minds to that} beLe hALAyitu, nAvu (ciMtisi Palavilalx) manasusx gaTiTx mADikoLaLxbeVku. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{30} \eng{out of one's mind} talekeTaTx; hucucx hiDida. 
\num{31} \eng{mind over matter} jaDajagatitxna meVle manasisxna parxButavx; aceVtana vishavxda meVle parxButavx sAthxpisuva manasisxna shakitx. 
\num{32} \eng{open} (\engit{or} \eng{close) one's mind to} hosa BAvanegaLu, badalAvaNegaLu, \mo vugaLige kaNuNx terediru (yA mucicxru), sivxVkarisuvaMtiru (yA sivxVkarisadaMtiru). 
\num{33} \eng{pass out of mind} = \hyperlink{mind1pagu17}{?pagu?\((17)\)}. 
\num{34} \hyperref{kandict_p.pdf}{P}{presence pagu(2)}{presence} \eng{of mind}. 
\hyperdef{M}{mind(1) pagu(35)}{} 
\num{35} \eng{put a person in mind of} obabxnige nenapukoDu, nenapu mADu. 
\hyperdef{M}{mind(1) pagu(36)}{} 
\num{36} \eng{put} (\engit{or} \eng{set) a person's mind at rest} obabx vayxkitxya manasasxnunx samAdhAnagoLisu, nirAtaMkagoLisu; manasisxge -- samAdhAna, nemamxdi taru; manasisxna ciMte, kaLavaLa, duguDa -- kaLe, pariharisu. 
\num{37} \eng{put a person} (\engit{or}) \eng{thing out of one's mind} udedxVshapUvaRkavAgi obabx vayxkitxyanunx (yA vasutxvanunx) mare. 
\num{38} \eng{read a person's mind} obabxna manasasxnunx, aBipArxyagaLanunx tiLiduko; obabxna iMgita ari. 
\num{39} \eng{set one's mind on} (EnanAnxdarU paDeyalu) manasusx mADu; iciCxsu; saMkalipxsu. 
\num{40} \eng{state of mind} manaHsithxti. 
\num{41} \eng{time out of mind} anAdi kAla; (nenapilalxdaSuTx) pArxciVna kAla. 
\num{42} \eng{to be on (one's) mind} manasisxge BAravAgiru; AtaMkavAgiru; ciMteyAgiru; yoVcaneyuMTu mADu: \eng{the approaching trial was on his mind} sadayxdalelxV baralidadx vicAraNe avanige yoVcaneyuMTu mADitutx. 
\num{43} \eng{to my mind} nananx manasisxge toVruvaMte; nananx aBipArxyadalilx. 
\enum
\emng
\eentry

\bentry
\word[must(5)]{must}
\pron{masfTx}
\gl{sahAyaka \kirx}
\bmng
(\parxpu\ \Eva\ \eng{must}; \BU\ \eng{must} yA \eng{had to}; dhAtavxthaRvAci, \vakaq\ matutx kaqnAnxma rUpagaLilalx). 
\bnum
\numi{1} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (avashayxvAgi, mADaleV-, AgaleV-) beVku: \eng{you must find it} niVnu adanunx kaMDuhiDiyaleV beVku. 
\alnum{b} (avashayxveMbudanunx aSuTx otitx heVLadidAdxga): \eng{it must be found} adanunx (heVgoV) kaMDuhiDiyabeVku. 
\alnum{c} (vayxMgAyxthaRka parxshenxgaLalilx) \eng{must you slam the door?} niVnu bAgilanunx dabArane baDiyabeVkeV? 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} KaMDita AgaleVbeVku: \eng{we must win in the end} koneyalilx nAvu jayisaleVbeVku. 
\num{3} (BUta athaRdalilx, Aga manasisxnalilx naDeyuva payARloVcaneyanunx varadi mADuvAga) \eng{it was too late now to retreat; he must make good his word or incur lasting disgrace} inunx himemxTaTxlu kAla miMcitutx; avanu tananx mAtanunx uLisikoLaLxbeVkAgitutx, ilalxveV shAshavxtavAda apakiVtiRge guriyAgabeVkAgitutx. 
\num{4} (aitihAsika vataRmAnada athaRdalilx, duradaqSaTxvanunx kuritu heVLuvAga) \eng{just as I was getting better, what must I do but break my leg?} guNavAgutAtx baMdidAdxgaleV, nAnu kAlu muridukoLaLxbeVkitetxV? 
\num{5} (KaMDita AgiraleV-, naDediraleV-)beVku: \eng{you must have known quite well} ninage cenAnxgi tiLidididxraleV beVku. 
\num{6} (anivAyaRvAgi AgiyeV tiVra-) beVkAgitutx: \eng{you must have caught it if you had read} niVnu Odidadxre adanunx niVnu garxhisirabeVkAgitutx, niVnu Odidadxre adanunx athaRmADikoLaLxleVbeVkAgitutx. 
\num{7} (adhiVna vAkayxda kirxyege anavxyisuva niSeVdhAthaRdalilx) -kUDadu; -bAradu: \eng{you must not smoke} niVnu dhUmapAna mADakUDadu: \eng{you must not worry} niVnu ciMte mADabAradu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\eng{I must say} (aneVka veVLe vayxMgayxvAgi) nAnu heVLa(leV)beVkAgide. nAnu heVLade iralu sAdhayxvilalx: \eng{I must say he made a good attempt} avanu oLeLxya parxyatanx mADidaneMdu heVLade iralu sAdhayxvilalx. 
\emng
\eentry
